words.translation: By those scattering|dispersing

translations.1: Waz-zaariyaati zarwaa
translations.15: By the winds scattering ˹dust˺

words.translation: And those carrying|a load

translations.1: Falhaamilaati wiqraa
translations.15: and ˹the clouds˺ loaded with rain

words.translation: And those sailing|(with) ease

translations.1: Faljaariyaati yusraa
translations.15: and ˹the ships˺ gliding with ease

words.translation: And those distributing|Command

translations.1: Falmuqassimaati amraa
translations.15: and ˹the angels˺ administering affairs by ˹Allah’s˺ command

words.translation: Indeed what|you are promised|(is) surely true

translations.1: Innamaa too'adoona la-saadiq
translations.15: Indeed, what you are promised is true

words.translation: And indeed|the Judgment|(is) surely to occur

translations.1: Wa-innad deena la-waaqi'
translations.15: And the Judgment will certainly come to pass

words.translation: By the heaven|full of|pathways

translations.1: Wassamaaa'i zaatil hubuk
translations.15: ˹And˺ by the heavens in their marvellous design

words.translation: Indeed you|(are) surely in|a speech|differing

translations.1: Innakum lafee qawlim mukhtalif
translations.15: Surely you are ˹lost˺ in conflicting views ˹regarding the truth˺

words.translation: Deluded away|from it|(is he) who|is deluded

translations.1: Yu'faku 'anhu man ufik
translations.15: Only those ˹destined to be˺ deluded are turned away from it

words.translation: Cursed be|the liars

translations.1: Qutilal kharraasoon
translations.15: Condemned are the liars—

words.translation: Those who|[they]|(are) in|flood|(of) heedlessness

translations.1: Allazeena hum fee ghamratin saahoon
translations.15: those who are ˹steeped˺ in ignorance, totally heedless

words.translation: They ask|When|(is the) Day|(of) Judgment

translations.1: Yas'aloona ayyaana yawmud Deen
translations.15: They ask ˹mockingly˺, “When is this Day of Judgment?”

words.translation: A Day|they|over|the Fire|will be tried

translations.1: Yawma hum 'alan naari yuftanoon
translations.15: ˹It is˺ the Day they will be tormented over the Fire

words.translation: Taste|your trial|This|(is) what|you were|for it|seeking to hasten

translations.1: Zooqoo fitnatakum haa-zal lazee kuntum bihee tas-ta'jiloon
translations.15: ˹They will be told,˺ “Taste your torment! This is what you sought to hasten.”

words.translation: Indeed|the righteous|(will be) in|Gardens|and springs

translations.1: Innal muttaqeena fee jannaatinw Wa-'uyoon
translations.15: Indeed, the righteous will be amid Gardens and springs

words.translation: Taking|what|(their Lord) has given them|their Lord|Indeed, they|were|before|that|good-doers

translations.1: Aakhizeena maaa aataahum Rabbuhum; innahum kaanoo qabla zaalika muhsineen
translations.15: ˹joyfully˺ receiving what their Lord will grant them. Before this ˹reward˺ they were truly good-doers ˹in the world˺

words.translation: They used (to)|little|of|the night|[what]|sleep

translations.1: kaanoo qaleelam minal laili maa yahja'oon
translations.15: they used to sleep only little in the night

words.translation: And in the hours before dawn|they|would ask forgiveness

translations.1: Wa-bilashaari hum yastaghfiroon
translations.15: and pray for forgiveness before dawn

words.translation: And in|their wealth|(was the) right|(of) those who asked|and the deprived

translations.1: Wa-feee amwaalihim haqqul lissaaa'ili walmahroom
translations.15: And in their wealth there was a rightful share ˹fulfilled˺ for the beggar and the poor

words.translation: And in|the earth|(are) signs|for those who are certain

translations.1: Wa-fil ardi aayaatul lilmooqineen
translations.15: There are ˹countless˺ signs on earth for those with sure faith

words.translation: And in|yourselves|Then will not|you see

translations.1: Wa-feee anfusikum; afalaa tubsiroon
translations.15: as there are within yourselves. Can you not see

words.translation: And in|the heaven|(is) your provision|and what|you are promised

translations.1: Wa-fis samaaa'i rizqukum Wa-maa too'adoon
translations.15: In heaven is your sustenance and whatever you are promised

words.translation: Then by (the) Lord|(of) the heaven|and the earth|indeed it|(is) surely (the) truth|(just) as|[what]|you|speak

translations.1: Fawa-Rabbis samaaa'i wal-ardi innahoo lahaqqum misla maa annakum tantiqoon
translations.15: Then by the Lord of heaven and earth! ˹All˺ this is certainly as true as ˹the fact that˺ you can speak

words.translation: Has|reached you|(the) narration|(of the) guests|(of) Ibrahim|the honored

translations.1: Hal ataaka hadeesu daifi Ibraaheemal mukrameen
translations.15: Has the story of Abraham’s honoured guests reached you ˹O Prophet˺

words.translation: When|they entered|upon him|and said|Peace|He said|Peace|a people|unknown

translations.1: Iz dakhaloo 'alaihi faqaaloo salaaman qaala salaamun qawmum munkaroon
translations.15: ˹Remember˺ when they entered his presence and greeted ˹him with˺, “Peace!” He replied, “Peace ˹be upon you˺!” ˹Then he said to himself,˺ “˹These are˺ an unfamiliar people.”

words.translation: Then he went|to|his household|and came|with a calf|fat

translations.1: Faraagha ilaaa ahlihee fajaaa'a bi'ijlin sameen
translations.15: Then he slipped off to his family and brought a fat ˹roasted˺ calf

words.translation: And he placed it near|[to] them|he said|Will not|you eat

translations.1: Faqarrabahooo ilaihim qaala alaa taakuloon
translations.15: and placed it before them, asking, “Will you not eat?”

words.translation: Then he felt|from them|a fear|They said|(Do) not|fear|and they gave him glad tidings|of a son|learned

translations.1: Fa-awjasa minhum khee-fatan qaaloo laa takhaf Wa-bashsharoohu bighulaamin 'aleem
translations.15: ˹They did not eat,˺ so he grew fearful of them. They reassured ˹him˺, “Do not be afraid,” and gave him good news of a knowledgeable son

words.translation: Then came forward|his wife|with|a loud voice|and struck|her face|and she said|An old woman|barren!

translations.1: Fa-aqbalatim ra-atuhoo fee sarratin fasakkat wajhahaa Wa-qaalat 'ajoozun 'aqeem
translations.15: Then his wife came forward with a cry, clasping her forehead ˹in astonishment˺, exclaiming, “˹A baby from˺ a barren, old woman!”

words.translation: They said|Thus|said|your Lord|Indeed He|[He]|(is) the All-Wise|the All-Knower

translations.1: Qaaloo kazaaliki qaala Rabbuki innahoo huwal hakeemul 'aleem
translations.15: They replied, “Such has your Lord decreed. He is truly the All-Wise, All-Knowing.”

words.translation: He said|Then what|(is) your mission|O messengers|O messengers

translations.1: Qaala famaa khatbukum ayyuhal mursaloon
translations.15: ˹Later,˺ Abraham asked, “What is your mission, O messengers?”

words.translation: They said|Indeed we|[we] have been sent|to|a people|criminal

translations.1: Qaalooo innaaa ursilnaaa ilaa qawmim mujrimeen
translations.15: They replied, “We have actually been sent to a wicked people

words.translation: That we may send down|upon them|stones|of|clay

translations.1: Linursila 'alaihim hijaa-ratam min teen
translations.15: to send upon them stones of ˹baked˺ clay

words.translation: Marked|by your Lord|by your Lord|for the transgressors

translations.1: Musawwamatan 'inda rabbika lilmusrifeen
translations.15: marked by your Lord for the transgressors.”

words.translation: Then We brought out|(those) who|were|therein|of|the believers

translations.1: Fa-akhrajnaa man kaana feehaa minal mu'mineen
translations.15: Then ˹before the torment˺ We evacuated the believers from the city

words.translation: But not|We found|therein|other than|a house|of|the Muslims

translations.1: Famaa wajadnaa feehaa ghaira baitim minal muslimeen
translations.15: But We only found one family that had submitted ˹to Allah˺

words.translation: And We left|therein|a Sign|for those who|fear|the punishment|the painful

translations.1: Wa-taraknaa feehaaa aayatal lillazeena yakhaafoonal 'azaabal aleem
translations.15: And We have left a sign there ˹as a lesson˺ for those who fear the painful punishment

words.translation: And in|Musa|when|We sent him|to|Firaun|with an authority|clear

translations.1: Wa-fee Moosaaa iz arsalnaahu ilaa Fir'awna bisultaa-nim mubeen
translations.15: And in ˹the story of˺ Moses ˹was another lesson,˺ when We sent him to Pharaoh with compelling proof

words.translation: But he turned away|with his supporters|and said|A magician|or|a madman

translations.1: Fatawalla biruknihee Wa-qaala saahirun aw majnoon
translations.15: but Pharaoh was carried away by his power, saying ˹of Moses˺, “A magician or a madman!”

words.translation: So We took him|and his hosts|and threw them|into|the sea|while he|(was) blameworthy

translations.1: Fa-akhaznaahu Wa-junoo-dahoo fanabaznaahum fil yammi Wa-huwa muleem
translations.15: So We seized him and his soldiers, casting them into the sea while he was blameworthy

words.translation: And in|Aad|when|We sent|against them|the wind|the barren

translations.1: Wa-fee 'Aadin iz arsalnaa 'alaihimur reehal 'aqeem
translations.15: And in ˹the story of˺ ’Âd ˹was another lesson,˺ when We sent against them the devastating wind

words.translation: Not|it left|any|thing|it came|upon it|but|it made it|like disintegrated ruins

translations.1: Maa tazaru min shai'in atat 'alaihi illaa ja'alat-hu karrameem
translations.15: There was nothing it came upon that it did not reduce to ashes

words.translation: And in|Thamud|when|was said|to them|Enjoy (yourselves)|for|a time

translations.1: Wa-fee Samooda iz qeela lahum tamatta''oo hattaa heen
translations.15: And in ˹the story of˺ Thamûd ˹was another lesson,˺ when they were told, “Enjoy yourselves ˹only˺ for a ˹short˺ while.”

words.translation: But they rebelled|against|(the) Command|(of) their Lord|so seized them|the thunderbolt|while they|were looking

translations.1: Fa'ataw 'an amri Rabbihim fa-akhazal-humus saa'iqatu Wa-hum yanzuroon
translations.15: Still they persisted in defying the commands of their Lord, so they were overtaken by a ˹mighty˺ blast while they were looking on

words.translation: Then not|they were able|to|stand|and not|they could|help themselves

translations.1: Famas tataa'oo min qiyaaminw Wa-maa kaanoo muntasireen
translations.15: Then they were not able to rise up, nor were they helped

words.translation: And (the) people|(of) Nuh|before|before|indeed, they|were|a people|defiantly disobedient

translations.1: Wa-qawma Noohim min qablu innahum kaano qawman faasiqeen
translations.15: And the people of Noah ˹had also been destroyed˺ earlier. They were truly a rebellious people

words.translation: And the Heaven|We constructed it|with strength|and indeed We|(are) surely (its) Expanders

translations.1: Wassamaaa'a banainaa-haa bi-aydinw Wa-innaa lamoosi'oon
translations.15: We built the universe with ˹great˺ might, and We are certainly expanding ˹it˺

words.translation: And the earth|We have spread it|how excellent|(are) the Spreaders

translations.1: Wal-arda farashnaahaa fani'mal maahidoon
translations.15: As for the earth, We spread it out. How superbly did We smooth it out

words.translation: And of|every|thing|We have created|pairs|so that you may|remember

translations.1: Wa-min kulli shai'in khalaqnaa zawjaini la'allakum tazakkaroon
translations.15: And We created pairs of all things so perhaps you would be mindful

words.translation: So flee|to|Allah|indeed I am|to you|from Him|a warner|clear

translations.1: Fafirrooo ilal laahi innee lakum minhu nazeerum mubeen
translations.15: So ˹proclaim, O Prophet˺: “Flee to Allah! I am truly sent by Him with a clear warning to you

words.translation: And (do) not|make|with|Allah|god|another|Indeed I am|to you|from Him|a warner|clear

translations.1: Wa-laa taj'aloo ma'al laahi ilaahan aakhara innee lakum minhu nazeerum mubeen
translations.15: And do not set up another god with Allah. I am truly sent by Him with a clear warning to you.”

words.translation: Likewise|not|came|(to) those|before them|before them|any|Messenger|but|they said|A magician|or|a madman

translations.1: Kazaalika maaa atal lazeena min qablihim mir Rasoolin illaa qaaloo saahirun aw majnoon
translations.15: Similarly, no messenger came to those before them without being told: “A magician or a madman!”

words.translation: Have they transmitted it to them|Have they transmitted it to them|Nay|they|(are) a people|transgressing

translations.1: Atawaasaw bih; bal hum qawmun taaghoon
translations.15: Have they passed this ˹cliché˺ down to one another? In fact, they have ˹all˺ been a transgressing people

words.translation: So turn away|from them|for not|you|(are) to be blamed

translations.1: Fatawalla 'anhum famaaa anta bimaloom
translations.15: So ˹now˺ turn away from them ˹O Prophet˺, for you will not be blamed

words.translation: And remind|for indeed|the reminder|benefits|the believers

translations.1: Wa-zakkir fa-innaz zikraa tanfa'ul mu'mineen
translations.15: But ˹continue to˺ remind. For certainly reminders benefit the believers

words.translation: And not|I have created|the jinn|and the mankind|except|that they worship Me

translations.1: Wa-maa khalaqtul jinna wal-insa illaa liya'budoon
translations.15: I did not create jinn and humans except to worship Me

words.translation: Not|I want|from them|any|provision|and not|I want|that|they (should) feed Me

translations.1: Maaa ureedu minhum mir rizqinw Wa-maaa ureedu aien yut'imoon
translations.15: I seek no provision from them, nor do I need them to feed Me

words.translation: Indeed|Allah|He|(is) the All-Provider|Possessor|(of) Power|the Strong

translations.1: Innal laaha Huwar Razzaaqu Zul Quwwatil Mateen
translations.15: Indeed, Allah ˹alone˺ is the Supreme Provider—Lord of all Power, Ever Mighty

words.translation: So indeed|for those who|do wrong|(is) a portion|like|(the) portion|(of) their companions|so let them not|ask Me to hasten

translations.1: Fa-inna lillazeena zalamoo zanoobam misla zanoobi ashaabihim falaa yasta'jiloon
translations.15: The wrongdoers will certainly have a share ˹of the torment˺ like that of their predecessors. So do not let them ask Me to hasten ˹it˺

words.translation: Then woe|to those who|disbelieve|from|their Day|which|they are promised

translations.1: Fawailul lillazeena kafaroo mien yawmihimul lazee yoo'adoon
translations.15: Woe then to the disbelievers when they face their Day which they are warned of
